intro: Paratropia avenis, commonly known as the common paratropia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Paratropia avenis is often found in rocky soils and is a popular choice for xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
